title: Week 5 Quiz: DCF & Valuation
description: Test your grasp of Free Cash Flow and formal grammar.

items.prompt: What does a 'Discount Rate' represent in a DCF?
options: A coupon code for the bank
The required rate of return or the risk of the investment
items.explanation: Higher risk usually leads to a higher discount rate.

items.prompt: Complete the subjunctive sentence: 'We recommend that the auditor ___ the figures again.'
CAPEX is ___ in the FCF formula.
items.explanation: CAPEX is a cash outflow for investment, so it reduces free cash flow.
Increased working capital means more cash is 'tied up' in operations (e.g., more inventory).
Compounding moves money forward in time; discounting moves it back to the present.
